com.stormpath.sdk.saml

Interface SamlIdpUrlBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSamlIdpUrlBuilder

    public interface SamlIdpUrlBuilder
    A Builder design pattern used to construct a URL you can use to redirect application users to a SAML authentication site (Identity Provider or IdP) for performing common user identity functionality. When users are done (authenticating, logging out, etc), they will be redirected back to a callbackUri of your choice. Example of building a basic Saml IdP Url: 
         String redirectUrl = application.newSamlIdpUrlBuilder()
      .setCallbackUri(String) setCallbackUri}(callbackUri)
      .build();
    Since:
    1.0.RC8
    See Also:
    Application.newSamlIdpUrlBuilder()

    • Method Detail

      • setCallbackUri

        SamlIdpUrlBuilder setCallbackUri(String callbackUri)
        Sets the location where the user will be sent when returning from the SAML Identity Provider. This property is mandatory and must be set. See the application.newSamlCallbackHandler documentation for information on how to process requests to your callbackUri.
        Parameters:
        callbackUri - the final destination where to get the browser redirected.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setState

        SamlIdpUrlBuilder setState(String state)
        Sets application-specific state that should be retained and made available to your callbackUri when the user returns from the SAML Identity Provider.
        Parameters:
        state - application-specific state that should be retained and made available to your callbackUri when the user returns from the SAML Identity Provider.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setPath

        SamlIdpUrlBuilder setPath(String path)
        Sets the initial path in the SAML Identity Provider where the user should be sent. If unspecified, this defaults to /, implying that the SAML Identity Provider's landing/home page is the desired location.
        Parameters:
        path - the initial path in the SAML Identity Provider where the user should be sent.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setOrganizationNameKey

        SamlIdpUrlBuilder setOrganizationNameKey(String organizationNameKey)
        Ensures the SAML Identity Provider is customized for the Organization with the specified organizationNameKey. This is useful for multi-tenant or white label scenarios where you know the user belongs to a specific Organization.
        Parameters:
        organizationNameKey - unique identifier of the Organization to use when customizing SAML Identity Provider.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setSpToken

        SamlIdpUrlBuilder setSpToken(String spToken)
        Sets the sp_token property used by the SAML Identity Provider to complete an account password reset workflow. The sp_token must correspond to an actual password reset token issued to one of the accounts of this application. If sp_token property is present and valid, the user will be redirected to the SAML Identity Provider URL (included the configured path, see setPath(String), with the sp_token embedded in the signed JWT.

        Example

        Assume your SAML Identity Provider is located at the domain id.myapp.com. If you specify a spToken of aSpToken and set path to #reset, the user will be sent to https://id.myapp.com/#reset?jwt=signedJwt, with the provided aSpToken value embedded in the signedJwt to complete the reset password process in your SAML Identity Provider.

        Parameters:
        spToken - a unique token used to reset a password.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • setAccountStoreHref

        SamlIdpUrlBuilder setAccountStoreHref(String accountStoreHref)
        Sets the ash property used by the SAML Identity Provider to complete a SAML authentication workflow. If ash property is present and valid, the user will be redirected to the SAML Identity Provider URL with the ash embedded in the signed JWT.
        Parameters:
        accountStoreHref - the account store href that indicates a SAML directory to authenticate against.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • addProperty

        SamlIdpUrlBuilder addProperty(String name,
                              Object value)
        Convenience method to set any key value. This is important to decouple the server releases from the library releases, when a new property is supported in the initial SAML Identity Provider call, and there is no setter to add such property during the initial request, this method can be used to add it.

        Example

        Assume the initial call for SAML Identity Provider now supports a new property called exp (expire), since at the moment there is no such method to set the new property, you can use this new convenience method to the key-value pair to the request.

        addProperty("exp", new Date()), cal

        Notes:

        1) Properties like "iat", "iss", and "iat" will be overriden when the SAML request URL is being built, to avoid conflicts when the url is being consumed by Stormpath. 2) Prefer the setter methods over this one (when possible), since there is type safe guarantee via the setters.

        Parameters:
        name - of the new property.
        value - of the new property.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • build

        String build()
        Builds and returns the fully qualified URL representing the initial location in the SAML Identity Provider where the end-user should be redirected.
        Returns:
        the fully qualified URL representing the initial location in the SAML Identity Provider where the end-user should be redirected.
